newsitem.title: NORWAY: Fokus Bank, Norsk Hydro give Oslo bourse a boost.
newsitem.headline: Fokus Bank, Norsk Hydro give Oslo bourse a boost.

text.p: Takeover target Fokus Bank and industrial group Norsk Hydro helped drive up the Total index on the Oslo Bourse in lively trade on Friday.

The index closed 0.76 percent higher at 1,177.41 points in turnover worth 1.25 billion crowns. Hydro was up 1.76 percent at 375 crowns while Fokus soared 10.6 percent to 73 crowns and was heavily traded at 228 million.

Sparebankgruppen, a group of savings banks which has made a hostile 73 crowns per-share bid for Fokus, said it now had a partner it would not identify. Players believed the group, through the partner, was behind most of the purchases in Fokus.
At 1400 GMT, Sparebankgruppen announced it now controlled 51 percent of shares in Fokus and was extending by six weeks its bid to shareholders in Norway's fourth largest bank.
Aker RGI's A share closed 3.70 percent higher at 140 crowns after the industrial holding company sold 21 million preference shares in insurance group Storebrand.

The company said it had sold the stock at 13.30 crowns per share because of a dispute with the Norwegian Banking, Insurance and Securities Commission on how many shares it may hold in Storebrand. The sale included an option to buy back the stock if Aker RGI wins an appeal to the Finance Ministry.
